Bible.Verse: 5 For unto which of the angels said he at any time, Thou art my Son, this day have I begotten thee? And again, I will be to him a Father, and he shall be to me a Son?

Bible.Title: Hebrews 1:
Bible.Verse: 6 And again, when he bringeth in the firstbegotten into the world, he saith, And let all the angels of God worship him.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 1:
Bible.Verse: 7 And of the angels he saith, Who maketh his angels spirits, and his ministers a flame of fire.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 1:
Bible.Verse: 8 But unto the Son he saith, Thy throne, O God, is for ever and ever: a sceptre of righteousness is the sceptre of thy kingdom.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 1:
Bible.Verse: 9 Thou hast loved righteousness, and hated iniquity; therefore God, even thy God, hath anointed thee with the oil of gladness above thy fellows.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 1:
Bible.Verse: 10 And, Thou, Lord, in the beginning hast laid the foundation of the earth; and the heavens are the works of thine hands:

Bible.Title: Hebrews 1:
Bible.Verse: 11 They shall perish; but thou remainest; and they all shall wax old as doth a garment;

Bible.Title: Hebrews 1:
Bible.Verse: 12 And as a vesture shalt thou fold them up, and they shall be changed: but thou art the same, and thy years shall not fail.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 1:
Bible.Verse: 13 But to which of the angels said he at any time, Sit on my right hand, until I make thine enemies thy footstool?

Bible.Title: Hebrews 1:
Bible.Verse: 14 Are they not all ministering spirits, sent forth to minister for them who shall be heirs of salvation?

Bible.Title: Hebrews 2:
Bible.Verse: 1 Therefore we ought to give the more earnest heed to the things which we have heard, lest at any time we should let them slip.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 2:
Bible.Verse: 2 For if the word spoken by angels was stedfast, and every transgression and disobedience received a just recompence of reward;

Bible.Title: Hebrews 2:
Bible.Verse: 3 How shall we escape, if we neglect so great salvation; which at the first began to be spoken by the Lord, and was confirmed unto us by them that heard him;

Bible.Title: Hebrews 2:
Bible.Verse: 4 God also bearing them witness, both with signs and wonders, and with divers miracles, and gifts of the Holy Ghost, according to his own will?

Bible.Title: Hebrews 2:
Bible.Verse: 5 For unto the angels hath he not put in subjection the world to come, whereof we speak.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 2:
Bible.Verse: 6 But one in a certain place testified, saying, What is man, that thou art mindful of him? or the son of man, that thou visitest him?

Bible.Title: Hebrews 2:
Bible.Verse: 7 Thou madest him a little lower than the angels; thou crownedst him with glory and honour, and didst set him over the works of thy hands:

Bible.Title: Hebrews 2:
Bible.Verse: 8 Thou hast put all things in subjection under his feet. For in that he put all in subjection under him, he left nothing that is not put under him. But now we see not yet all things put under him.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 2:
Bible.Verse: 9 But we see Jesus, who was made a little lower than the angels for the suffering of death, crowned with glory and honour; that he by the grace of God should taste death for every man.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 2:
Bible.Verse: 10 For it became him, for whom are all things, and by whom are all things, in bringing many sons unto glory, to make the captain of their salvation perfect through sufferings.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 2:
Bible.Verse: 11 For both he that sanctifieth and they who are sanctified are all of one: for which cause he is not ashamed to call them brethren,

Bible.Title: Hebrews 2:
Bible.Verse: 12 Saying, I will declare thy name unto my brethren, in the midst of the church will I sing praise unto thee.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 2:
Bible.Verse: 13 And again, I will put my trust in him. And again, Behold I and the children which God hath given me.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 2:
Bible.Verse: 14 Forasmuch then as the children are partakers of flesh and blood, he also himself likewise took part of the same; that through death he might destroy him that had the power of death, that is, the devil;

Bible.Title: Hebrews 2:
Bible.Verse: 15 And deliver them who through fear of death were all their lifetime subject to bondage.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 2:
Bible.Verse: 16 For verily he took not on him the nature of angels; but he took on him the seed of Abraham.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 2:
Bible.Verse: 17 Wherefore in all things it behoved him to be made like unto his brethren, that he might be a merciful and faithful high priest in things pertaining to God, to make reconciliation for the sins of the people.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 2:
Bible.Verse: 18 For in that he himself hath suffered being tempted, he is able to succour them that are tempted.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 3:
Bible.Verse: 1 Wherefore, holy brethren, partakers of the heavenly calling, consider the Apostle and High Priest of our profession, Christ Jesus;

Bible.Title: Hebrews 3:
Bible.Verse: 2 Who was faithful to him that appointed him, as also Moses was faithful in all his house.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 3:
Bible.Verse: 3 For this man was counted worthy of more glory than Moses, inasmuch as he who hath builded the house hath more honour than the house.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 3:
Bible.Verse: 4 For every house is builded by some man; but he that built all things is God.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 3:
Bible.Verse: 5 And Moses verily was faithful in all his house, as a servant, for a testimony of those things which were to be spoken after;

Bible.Title: Hebrews 3:
Bible.Verse: 6 But Christ as a son over his own house; whose house are we, if we hold fast the confidence and the rejoicing of the hope firm unto the end.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 3:
Bible.Verse: 7 Wherefore (as the Holy Ghost saith, To day if ye will hear his voice,

Bible.Title: Hebrews 3:
Bible.Verse: 8 Harden not your hearts, as in the provocation, in the day of temptation in the wilderness:

Bible.Title: Hebrews 3:
Bible.Verse: 9 When your fathers tempted me, proved me, and saw my works forty years.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 3:
Bible.Verse: 10 Wherefore I was grieved with that generation, and said, They do alway err in their heart; and they have not known my ways.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 3:
Bible.Verse: 11 So I sware in my wrath, They shall not enter into my rest.)

Bible.Title: Hebrews 3:
Bible.Verse: 12 Take heed, brethren, lest there be in any of you an evil heart of unbelief, in departing from the living God.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 3:
Bible.Verse: 13 But exhort one another daily, while it is called To day; lest any of you be hardened through the deceitfulness of sin.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 3:
Bible.Verse: 14 For we are made partakers of Christ, if we hold the beginning of our confidence stedfast unto the end;

Bible.Title: Hebrews 3:
Bible.Verse: 15 While it is said, To day if ye will hear his voice, harden not your hearts, as in the provocation.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 3:
Bible.Verse: 16 For some, when they had heard, did provoke: howbeit not all that came out of Egypt by Moses.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 3:
Bible.Verse: 17 But with whom was he grieved forty years? was it not with them that had sinned, whose carcases fell in the wilderness?

Bible.Title: Hebrews 3:
Bible.Verse: 18 And to whom sware he that they should not enter into his rest, but to them that believed not?

Bible.Title: Hebrews 3:
Bible.Verse: 19 So we see that they could not enter in because of unbelief.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 4:
Bible.Verse: 1 Let us therefore fear, lest, a promise being left us of entering into his rest, any of you should seem to come short of it.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 4:
Bible.Verse: 2 For unto us was the gospel preached, as well as unto them: but the word preached did not profit them, not being mixed with faith in them that heard it.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 4:
Bible.Verse: 3 For we which have believed do enter into rest, as he said, As I have sworn in my wrath, if they shall enter into my rest: although the works were finished from the foundation of the world.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 4:
Bible.Verse: 4 For he spake in a certain place of the seventh day on this wise, And God did rest the seventh day from all his works.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 4:
Bible.Verse: 5 And in this place again, If they shall enter into my rest.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 4:
Bible.Verse: 6 Seeing therefore it remaineth that some must enter therein, and they to whom it was first preached entered not in because of unbelief:

Bible.Title: Hebrews 4:
Bible.Verse: 7 Again, he limiteth a certain day, saying in David, To day, after so long a time; as it is said, To day if ye will hear his voice, harden not your hearts.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 4:
Bible.Verse: 8 For if Jesus had given them rest, then would he not afterward have spoken of another day.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 4:
Bible.Verse: 9 There remaineth therefore a rest to the people of God.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 4:
Bible.Verse: 10 For he that is entered into his rest, he also hath ceased from his own works, as God did from his.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 4:
Bible.Verse: 11 Let us labour therefore to enter into that rest, lest any man fall after the same example of unbelief.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 4:
Bible.Verse: 12 For the word of God is quick, and powerful, and sharper than any twoedged sword, piercing even to the dividing asunder of soul and spirit, and of the joints and marrow, and is a discerner of the thoughts and intents of the heart.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 4:
Bible.Verse: 13 Neither is there any creature that is not manifest in his sight: but all things are naked and opened unto the eyes of him with whom we have to do.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 4:
Bible.Verse: 14 Seeing then that we have a great high priest, that is passed into the heavens, Jesus the Son of God, let us hold fast our profession.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 4:
Bible.Verse: 15 For we have not an high priest which cannot be touched with the feeling of our infirmities; but was in all points tempted like as we are, yet without sin.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 4:
Bible.Verse: 16 Let us therefore come boldly unto the throne of grace, that we may obtain mercy, and find grace to help in time of need.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 5:
Bible.Verse: 1 For every high priest taken from among men is ordained for men in things pertaining to God, that he may offer both gifts and sacrifices for sins:

Bible.Title: Hebrews 5:
Bible.Verse: 2 Who can have compassion on the ignorant, and on them that are out of the way; for that he himself also is compassed with infirmity.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 5:
Bible.Verse: 3 And by reason hereof he ought, as for the people, so also for himself, to offer for sins.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 5:
Bible.Verse: 4 And no man taketh this honour unto himself, but he that is called of God, as was Aaron.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 5:
Bible.Verse: 5 So also Christ glorified not himself to be made an high priest; but he that said unto him, Thou art my Son, to day have I begotten thee.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 5:
Bible.Verse: 6 As he saith also in another place, Thou art a priest for ever after the order of Melchisedec.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 5:
Bible.Verse: 7 Who in the days of his flesh, when he had offered up prayers and supplications with strong crying and tears unto him that was able to save him from death, and was heard in that he feared;

Bible.Title: Hebrews 5:
Bible.Verse: 8 Though he were a Son, yet learned he obedience by the things which he suffered;

Bible.Title: Hebrews 5:
Bible.Verse: 9 And being made perfect, he became the author of eternal salvation unto all them that obey him;

Bible.Title: Hebrews 5:
Bible.Verse: 10 Called of God an high priest after the order of Melchisedec.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 5:
Bible.Verse: 11 Of whom we have many things to say, and hard to be uttered, seeing ye are dull of hearing.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 5:
Bible.Verse: 12 For when for the time ye ought to be teachers, ye have need that one teach you again which be the first principles of the oracles of God; and are become such as have need of milk, and not of strong meat.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 5:
Bible.Verse: 13 For every one that useth milk is unskilful in the word of righteousness: for he is a babe.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 5:
Bible.Verse: 14 But strong meat belongeth to them that are of full age, even those who by reason of use have their senses exercised to discern both good and evil.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 6:
Bible.Verse: 1 Therefore leaving the principles of the doctrine of Christ, let us go on unto perfection; not laying again the foundation of repentance from dead works, and of faith toward God,

Bible.Title: Hebrews 6:
Bible.Verse: 2 Of the doctrine of baptisms, and of laying on of hands, and of resurrection of the dead, and of eternal judgment.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 6:
Bible.Verse: 3 And this will we do, if God permit.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 6:
Bible.Verse: 4 For it is impossible for those who were once enlightened, and have tasted of the heavenly gift, and were made partakers of the Holy Ghost,

Bible.Title: Hebrews 6:
Bible.Verse: 5 And have tasted the good word of God, and the powers of the world to come,

Bible.Title: Hebrews 6:
Bible.Verse: 6 If they shall fall away, to renew them again unto repentance; seeing they crucify to themselves the Son of God afresh, and put him to an open shame.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 6:
Bible.Verse: 7 For the earth which drinketh in the rain that cometh oft upon it, and bringeth forth herbs meet for them by whom it is dressed, receiveth blessing from God:

Bible.Title: Hebrews 6:
Bible.Verse: 8 But that which beareth thorns and briers is rejected, and is nigh unto cursing; whose end is to be burned.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 6:
Bible.Verse: 9 But, beloved, we are persuaded better things of you, and things that accompany salvation, though we thus speak.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 6:
Bible.Verse: 10 For God is not unrighteous to forget your work and labour of love, which ye have shewed toward his name, in that ye have ministered to the saints, and do minister.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 6:
Bible.Verse: 11 And we desire that every one of you do shew the same diligence to the full assurance of hope unto the end:

Bible.Title: Hebrews 6:
Bible.Verse: 12 That ye be not slothful, but followers of them who through faith and patience inherit the promises.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 6:
Bible.Verse: 13 For when God made promise to Abraham, because he could swear by no greater, he sware by himself,

Bible.Title: Hebrews 6:
Bible.Verse: 14 Saying, Surely blessing I will bless thee, and multiplying I will multiply thee.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 6:
Bible.Verse: 15 And so, after he had patiently endured, he obtained the promise.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 6:
Bible.Verse: 16 For men verily swear by the greater: and an oath for confirmation is to them an end of all strife.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 6:
Bible.Verse: 17 Wherein God, willing more abundantly to shew unto the heirs of promise the immutability of his counsel, confirmed it by an oath:

Bible.Title: Hebrews 6:
Bible.Verse: 18 That by two immutable things, in which it was impossible for God to lie, we might have a strong consolation, who have fled for refuge to lay hold upon the hope set before us:

Bible.Title: Hebrews 6:
Bible.Verse: 19 Which hope we have as an anchor of the soul, both sure and stedfast, and which entereth into that within the veil;

Bible.Title: Hebrews 6:
Bible.Verse: 20 Whither the forerunner is for us entered, even Jesus, made an high priest for ever after the order of Melchisedec.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 7:
Bible.Verse: 1 For this Melchisedec, king of Salem, priest of the most high God, who met Abraham returning from the slaughter of the kings, and blessed him;

Bible.Title: Hebrews 7:
Bible.Verse: 2 To whom also Abraham gave a tenth part of all; first being by interpretation King of righteousness, and after that also King of Salem, which is, King of peace;

Bible.Title: Hebrews 7:
Bible.Verse: 3 Without father, without mother, without descent, having neither beginning of days, nor end of life; but made like unto the Son of God; abideth a priest continually.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 7:
Bible.Verse: 4 Now consider how great this man was, unto whom even the patriarch Abraham gave the tenth of the spoils.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 7:
Bible.Verse: 5 And verily they that are of the sons of Levi, who receive the office of the priesthood, have a commandment to take tithes of the people according to the law, that is, of their brethren, though they come out of the loins of Abraham:

Bible.Title: Hebrews 7:
Bible.Verse: 6 But he whose descent is not counted from them received tithes of Abraham, and blessed him that had the promises.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 7:
Bible.Verse: 7 And without all contradiction the less is blessed of the better.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 7:
Bible.Verse: 8 And here men that die receive tithes; but there he receiveth them, of whom it is witnessed that he liveth.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 7:
Bible.Verse: 9 And as I may so say, Levi also, who receiveth tithes, payed tithes in Abraham.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 7:
Bible.Verse: 10 For he was yet in the loins of his father, when Melchisedec met him.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 7:
Bible.Verse: 11 If therefore perfection were by the Levitical priesthood, (for under it the people received the law,) what further need was there that another priest should rise after the order of Melchisedec, and not be called after the order of Aaron?

Bible.Title: Hebrews 7:
Bible.Verse: 12 For the priesthood being changed, there is made of necessity a change also of the law.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 7:
Bible.Verse: 13 For he of whom these things are spoken pertaineth to another tribe, of which no man gave attendance at the altar.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 7:
Bible.Verse: 14 For it is evident that our Lord sprang out of Juda; of which tribe Moses spake nothing concerning priesthood.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 7:
Bible.Verse: 15 And it is yet far more evident: for that after the similitude of Melchisedec there ariseth another priest,

Bible.Title: Hebrews 7:
Bible.Verse: 16 Who is made, not after the law of a carnal commandment, but after the power of an endless life.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 7:
Bible.Verse: 17 For he testifieth, Thou art a priest for ever after the order of Melchisedec.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 7:
Bible.Verse: 18 For there is verily a disannulling of the commandment going before for the weakness and unprofitableness thereof.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 7:
Bible.Verse: 19 For the law made nothing perfect, but the bringing in of a better hope did; by the which we draw nigh unto God.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 7:
Bible.Verse: 20 And inasmuch as not without an oath he was made priest:

Bible.Title: Hebrews 7:
Bible.Verse: 21 (For those priests were made without an oath; but this with an oath by him that said unto him, The Lord sware and will not repent, Thou art a priest for ever after the order of Melchisedec:)

Bible.Title: Hebrews 7:
Bible.Verse: 22 By so much was Jesus made a surety of a better testament.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 7:
Bible.Verse: 23 And they truly were many priests, because they were not suffered to continue by reason of death:

Bible.Title: Hebrews 7:
Bible.Verse: 24 But this man, because he continueth ever, hath an unchangeable priesthood.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 7:
Bible.Verse: 25 Wherefore he is able also to save them to the uttermost that come unto God by him, seeing he ever liveth to make intercession for them.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 7:
Bible.Verse: 26 For such an high priest became us, who is holy, harmless, undefiled, separate from sinners, and made higher than the heavens;

Bible.Title: Hebrews 7:
Bible.Verse: 27 Who needeth not daily, as those high priests, to offer up sacrifice, first for his own sins, and then for the people's: for this he did once, when he offered up himself.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 7:
Bible.Verse: 28 For the law maketh men high priests which have infirmity; but the word of the oath, which was since the law, maketh the Son, who is consecrated for evermore.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 8:
Bible.Verse: 1 Now of the things which we have spoken this is the sum: We have such an high priest, who is set on the right hand of the throne of the Majesty in the heavens;

Bible.Title: Hebrews 8:
Bible.Verse: 2 A minister of the sanctuary, and of the true tabernacle, which the Lord pitched, and not man.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 8:
Bible.Verse: 3 For every high priest is ordained to offer gifts and sacrifices: wherefore it is of necessity that this man have somewhat also to offer.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 8:
Bible.Verse: 4 For if he were on earth, he should not be a priest, seeing that there are priests that offer gifts according to the law:

Bible.Title: Hebrews 8:
Bible.Verse: 5 Who serve unto the example and shadow of heavenly things, as Moses was admonished of God when he was about to make the tabernacle: for, See, saith he, that thou make all things according to the pattern shewed to thee in the mount.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 8:
Bible.Verse: 6 But now hath he obtained a more excellent ministry, by how much also he is the mediator of a better covenant, which was established upon better promises.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 8:
Bible.Verse: 7 For if that first covenant had been faultless, then should no place have been sought for the second.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 8:
Bible.Verse: 8 For finding fault with them, he saith, Behold, the days come, saith the Lord, when I will make a new covenant with the house of Israel and with the house of Judah:

Bible.Title: Hebrews 8:
Bible.Verse: 9 Not according to the covenant that I made with their fathers in the day when I took them by the hand to lead them out of the land of Egypt; because they continued not in my covenant, and I regarded them not, saith the Lord.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 8:
Bible.Verse: 10 For this is the covenant that I will make with the house of Israel after those days, saith the Lord; I will put my laws into their mind, and write them in their hearts: and I will be to them a God, and they shall be to me a people:

Bible.Title: Hebrews 8:
Bible.Verse: 11 And they shall not teach every man his neighbour, and every man his brother, saying, Know the Lord: for all shall know me, from the least to the greatest.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 8:
Bible.Verse: 12 For I will be merciful to their unrighteousness, and their sins and their iniquities will I remember no more.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 8:
Bible.Verse: 13 In that he saith, A new covenant, he hath made the first old. Now that which decayeth and waxeth old is ready to vanish away.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 9:
Bible.Verse: 1 Then verily the first covenant had also ordinances of divine service, and a worldly sanctuary.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 9:
Bible.Verse: 2 For there was a tabernacle made; the first, wherein was the candlestick, and the table, and the shewbread; which is called the sanctuary.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 9:
Bible.Verse: 3 And after the second veil, the tabernacle which is called the Holiest of all;

Bible.Title: Hebrews 9:
Bible.Verse: 4 Which had the golden censer, and the ark of the covenant overlaid round about with gold, wherein was the golden pot that had manna, and Aaron's rod that budded, and the tables of the covenant;

Bible.Title: Hebrews 9:
Bible.Verse: 5 And over it the cherubims of glory shadowing the mercyseat; of which we cannot now speak particularly.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 9:
Bible.Verse: 6 Now when these things were thus ordained, the priests went always into the first tabernacle, accomplishing the service of God.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 9:
Bible.Verse: 7 But into the second went the high priest alone once every year, not without blood, which he offered for himself, and for the errors of the people:

Bible.Title: Hebrews 9:
Bible.Verse: 8 The Holy Ghost this signifying, that the way into the holiest of all was not yet made manifest, while as the first tabernacle was yet standing:

Bible.Title: Hebrews 9:
Bible.Verse: 9 Which was a figure for the time then present, in which were offered both gifts and sacrifices, that could not make him that did the service perfect, as pertaining to the conscience;

Bible.Title: Hebrews 9:
Bible.Verse: 10 Which stood only in meats and drinks, and divers washings, and carnal ordinances, imposed on them until the time of reformation.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 9:
Bible.Verse: 11 But Christ being come an high priest of good things to come, by a greater and more perfect tabernacle, not made with hands, that is to say, not of this building;

Bible.Title: Hebrews 9:
Bible.Verse: 12 Neither by the blood of goats and calves, but by his own blood he entered in once into the holy place, having obtained eternal redemption for us.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 9:
Bible.Verse: 13 For if the blood of bulls and of goats, and the ashes of an heifer sprinkling the unclean, sanctifieth to the purifying of the flesh:

Bible.Title: Hebrews 9:
Bible.Verse: 14 How much more shall the blood of Christ, who through the eternal Spirit offered himself without spot to God, purge your conscience from dead works to serve the living God?

Bible.Title: Hebrews 9:
Bible.Verse: 15 And for this cause he is the mediator of the new testament, that by means of death, for the redemption of the transgressions that were under the first testament, they which are called might receive the promise of eternal inheritance.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 9:
Bible.Verse: 16 For where a testament is, there must also of necessity be the death of the testator.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 9:
Bible.Verse: 17 For a testament is of force after men are dead: otherwise it is of no strength at all while the testator liveth.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 9:
Bible.Verse: 18 Whereupon neither the first testament was dedicated without blood.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 9:
Bible.Verse: 19 For when Moses had spoken every precept to all the people according to the law, he took the blood of calves and of goats, with water, and scarlet wool, and hyssop, and sprinkled both the book, and all the people,

Bible.Title: Hebrews 9:
Bible.Verse: 20 Saying, This is the blood of the testament which God hath enjoined unto you.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 9:
Bible.Verse: 21 Moreover he sprinkled with blood both the tabernacle, and all the vessels of the ministry.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 9:
Bible.Verse: 22 And almost all things are by the law purged with blood; and without shedding of blood is no remission.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 9:
Bible.Verse: 23 It was therefore necessary that the patterns of things in the heavens should be purified with these; but the heavenly things themselves with better sacrifices than these.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 9:
Bible.Verse: 24 For Christ is not entered into the holy places made with hands, which are the figures of the true; but into heaven itself, now to appear in the presence of God for us:

Bible.Title: Hebrews 9:
Bible.Verse: 25 Nor yet that he should offer himself often, as the high priest entereth into the holy place every year with blood of others;

Bible.Title: Hebrews 9:
Bible.Verse: 26 For then must he often have suffered since the foundation of the world: but now once in the end of the world hath he appeared to put away sin by the sacrifice of himself.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 9:
Bible.Verse: 27 And as it is appointed unto men once to die, but after this the judgment:

Bible.Title: Hebrews 9:
Bible.Verse: 28 So Christ was once offered to bear the sins of many; and unto them that look for him shall he appear the second time without sin unto salvation.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 10:
Bible.Verse: 1 For the law having a shadow of good things to come, and not the very image of the things, can never with those sacrifices which they offered year by year continually make the comers thereunto perfect.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 10:
Bible.Verse: 2 For then would they not have ceased to be offered? because that the worshippers once purged should have had no more conscience of sins.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 10:
Bible.Verse: 3 But in those sacrifices there is a remembrance again made of sins every year.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 10:
Bible.Verse: 4 For it is not possible that the blood of bulls and of goats should take away sins.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 10:
Bible.Verse: 5 Wherefore when he cometh into the world, he saith, Sacrifice and offering thou wouldest not, but a body hast thou prepared me:

Bible.Title: Hebrews 10:
Bible.Verse: 6 In burnt offerings and sacrifices for sin thou hast had no pleasure.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 10:
Bible.Verse: 7 Then said I, Lo, I come (in the volume of the book it is written of me,) to do thy will, O God.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 10:
Bible.Verse: 8 Above when he said, Sacrifice and offering and burnt offerings and offering for sin thou wouldest not, neither hadst pleasure therein; which are offered by the law;

Bible.Title: Hebrews 10:
Bible.Verse: 9 Then said he, Lo, I come to do thy will, O God. He taketh away the first, that he may establish the second.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 10:
Bible.Verse: 10 By the which will we are sanctified through the offering of the body of Jesus Christ once for all.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 10:
Bible.Verse: 11 And every priest standeth daily ministering and offering oftentimes the same sacrifices, which can never take away sins:

Bible.Title: Hebrews 10:
Bible.Verse: 12 But this man, after he had offered one sacrifice for sins for ever, sat down on the right hand of God;

Bible.Title: Hebrews 10:
Bible.Verse: 13 From henceforth expecting till his enemies be made his footstool.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 10:
Bible.Verse: 14 For by one offering he hath perfected for ever them that are sanctified.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 10:
Bible.Verse: 15 Whereof the Holy Ghost also is a witness to us: for after that he had said before,

Bible.Title: Hebrews 10:
Bible.Verse: 16 This is the covenant that I will make with them after those days, saith the Lord, I will put my laws into their hearts, and in their minds will I write them;

Bible.Title: Hebrews 10:
Bible.Verse: 17 And their sins and iniquities will I remember no more.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 10:
Bible.Verse: 18 Now where remission of these is, there is no more offering for sin.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 10:
Bible.Verse: 19 Having therefore, brethren, boldness to enter into the holiest by the blood of Jesus,

Bible.Title: Hebrews 10:
Bible.Verse: 20 By a new and living way, which he hath consecrated for us, through the veil, that is to say, his flesh;

Bible.Title: Hebrews 10:
Bible.Verse: 21 And having an high priest over the house of God;

Bible.Title: Hebrews 10:
Bible.Verse: 22 Let us draw near with a true heart in full assurance of faith, having our hearts sprinkled from an evil conscience, and our bodies washed with pure water.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 10:
Bible.Verse: 23 Let us hold fast the profession of our faith without wavering; (for he is faithful that promised;)

Bible.Title: Hebrews 10:
Bible.Verse: 24 And let us consider one another to provoke unto love and to good works:

Bible.Title: Hebrews 10:
Bible.Verse: 25 Not forsaking the assembling of ourselves together, as the manner of some is; but exhorting one another: and so much the more, as ye see the day approaching.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 10:
Bible.Verse: 26 For if we sin wilfully after that we have received the knowledge of the truth, there remaineth no more sacrifice for sins,

Bible.Title: Hebrews 10:
Bible.Verse: 27 But a certain fearful looking for of judgment and fiery indignation, which shall devour the adversaries.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 10:
Bible.Verse: 28 He that despised Moses' law died without mercy under two or three witnesses:

Bible.Title: Hebrews 10:
Bible.Verse: 29 Of how much sorer punishment, suppose ye, shall he be thought worthy, who hath trodden under foot the Son of God, and hath counted the blood of the covenant, wherewith he was sanctified, an unholy thing, and hath done despite unto the Spirit of grace?

Bible.Title: Hebrews 10:
Bible.Verse: 30 For we know him that hath said, Vengeance belongeth unto me, I will recompense, saith the Lord. And again, The Lord shall judge his people.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 10:
Bible.Verse: 31 It is a fearful thing to fall into the hands of the living God.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 10:
Bible.Verse: 32 But call to remembrance the former days, in which, after ye were illuminated, ye endured a great fight of afflictions;

Bible.Title: Hebrews 10:
Bible.Verse: 33 Partly, whilst ye were made a gazingstock both by reproaches and afflictions; and partly, whilst ye became companions of them that were so used.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 10:
Bible.Verse: 34 For ye had compassion of me in my bonds, and took joyfully the spoiling of your goods, knowing in yourselves that ye have in heaven a better and an enduring substance.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 10:
Bible.Verse: 35 Cast not away therefore your confidence, which hath great recompence of reward.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 10:
Bible.Verse: 36 For ye have need of patience, that, after ye have done the will of God, ye might receive the promise.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 10:
Bible.Verse: 37 For yet a little while, and he that shall come will come, and will not tarry.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 10:
Bible.Verse: 38 Now the just shall live by faith: but if any man draw back, my soul shall have no pleasure in him.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 10:
Bible.Verse: 39 But we are not of them who draw back unto perdition; but of them that believe to the saving of the soul.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 11:
Bible.Verse: 1 Now faith is the substance of things hoped for, the evidence of things not seen.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 11:
Bible.Verse: 2 For by it the elders obtained a good report.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 11:
Bible.Verse: 3 Through faith we understand that the worlds were framed by the word of God, so that things which are seen were not made of things which do appear.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 11:
Bible.Verse: 4 By faith Abel offered unto God a more excellent sacrifice than Cain, by which he obtained witness that he was righteous, God testifying of his gifts: and by it he being dead yet speaketh.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 11:
Bible.Verse: 5 By faith Enoch was translated that he should not see death; and was not found, because God had translated him: for before his translation he had this testimony, that he pleased God.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 11:
Bible.Verse: 6 But without faith it is impossible to please him: for he that cometh to God must believe that he is, and that he is a rewarder of them that diligently seek him.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 11:
Bible.Verse: 7 By faith Noah, being warned of God of things not seen as yet, moved with fear, prepared an ark to the saving of his house; by the which he condemned the world, and became heir of the righteousness which is by faith.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 11:
Bible.Verse: 8 By faith Abraham, when he was called to go out into a place which he should after receive for an inheritance, obeyed; and he went out, not knowing whither he went.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 11:
Bible.Verse: 9 By faith he sojourned in the land of promise, as in a strange country, dwelling in tabernacles with Isaac and Jacob, the heirs with him of the same promise:

Bible.Title: Hebrews 11:
Bible.Verse: 10 For he looked for a city which hath foundations, whose builder and maker is God.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 11:
Bible.Verse: 11 Through faith also Sara herself received strength to conceive seed, and was delivered of a child when she was past age, because she judged him faithful who had promised.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 11:
Bible.Verse: 12 Therefore sprang there even of one, and him as good as dead, so many as the stars of the sky in multitude, and as the sand which is by the sea shore innumerable.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 11:
Bible.Verse: 13 These all died in faith, not having received the promises, but having seen them afar off, and were persuaded of them, and embraced them, and confessed that they were strangers and pilgrims on the earth.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 11:
Bible.Verse: 14 For they that say such things declare plainly that they seek a country.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 11:
Bible.Verse: 15 And truly, if they had been mindful of that country from whence they came out, they might have had opportunity to have returned.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 11:
Bible.Verse: 16 But now they desire a better country, that is, an heavenly: wherefore God is not ashamed to be called their God: for he hath prepared for them a city.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 11:
Bible.Verse: 17 By faith Abraham, when he was tried, offered up Isaac: and he that had received the promises offered up his only begotten son,

Bible.Title: Hebrews 11:
Bible.Verse: 18 Of whom it was said, That in Isaac shall thy seed be called:

Bible.Title: Hebrews 11:
Bible.Verse: 19 Accounting that God was able to raise him up, even from the dead; from whence also he received him in a figure.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 11:
Bible.Verse: 20 By faith Isaac blessed Jacob and Esau concerning things to come.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 11:
Bible.Verse: 21 By faith Jacob, when he was a dying, blessed both the sons of Joseph; and worshipped, leaning upon the top of his staff.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 11:
Bible.Verse: 22 By faith Joseph, when he died, made mention of the departing of the children of Israel; and gave commandment concerning his bones.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 11:
Bible.Verse: 23 By faith Moses, when he was born, was hid three months of his parents, because they saw he was a proper child; and they were not afraid of the king's commandment.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 11:
Bible.Verse: 24 By faith Moses, when he was come to years, refused to be called the son of Pharaoh's daughter;

Bible.Title: Hebrews 11:
Bible.Verse: 25 Choosing rather to suffer affliction with the people of God, than to enjoy the pleasures of sin for a season;

Bible.Title: Hebrews 11:
Bible.Verse: 26 Esteeming the reproach of Christ greater riches than the treasures in Egypt: for he had respect unto the recompence of the reward.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 11:
Bible.Verse: 27 By faith he forsook Egypt, not fearing the wrath of the king: for he endured, as seeing him who is invisible.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 11:
Bible.Verse: 28 Through faith he kept the passover, and the sprinkling of blood, lest he that destroyed the firstborn should touch them.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 11:
Bible.Verse: 29 By faith they passed through the Red sea as by dry land: which the Egyptians assaying to do were drowned.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 11:
Bible.Verse: 30 By faith the walls of Jericho fell down, after they were compassed about seven days.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 11:
Bible.Verse: 31 By faith the harlot Rahab perished not with them that believed not, when she had received the spies with peace.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 11:
Bible.Verse: 32 And what shall I more say? for the time would fail me to tell of Gedeon, and of Barak, and of Samson, and of Jephthae; of David also, and Samuel, and of the prophets:

Bible.Title: Hebrews 11:
Bible.Verse: 33 Who through faith subdued kingdoms, wrought righteousness, obtained promises, stopped the mouths of lions,

Bible.Title: Hebrews 11:
Bible.Verse: 34 Quenched the violence of fire, escaped the edge of the sword, out of weakness were made strong, waxed valiant in fight, turned to flight the armies of the aliens.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 11:
Bible.Verse: 35 Women received their dead raised to life again: and others were tortured, not accepting deliverance; that they might obtain a better resurrection:

Bible.Title: Hebrews 11:
Bible.Verse: 36 And others had trial of cruel mockings and scourgings, yea, moreover of bonds and imprisonment:

Bible.Title: Hebrews 11:
Bible.Verse: 37 They were stoned, they were sawn asunder, were tempted, were slain with the sword: they wandered about in sheepskins and goatskins; being destitute, afflicted, tormented;

Bible.Title: Hebrews 11:
Bible.Verse: 38 (Of whom the world was not worthy:) they wandered in deserts, and in mountains, and in dens and caves of the earth.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 11:
Bible.Verse: 39 And these all, having obtained a good report through faith, received not the promise:

Bible.Title: Hebrews 11:
Bible.Verse: 40 God having provided some better thing for us, that they without us should not be made perfect.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 12:
Bible.Verse: 1 Wherefore seeing we also are compassed about with so great a cloud of witnesses, let us lay aside every weight, and the sin which doth so easily beset us, and let us run with patience the race that is set before us,

Bible.Title: Hebrews 12:
Bible.Verse: 2 Looking unto Jesus the author and finisher of our faith; who for the joy that was set before him endured the cross, despising the shame, and is set down at the right hand of the throne of God.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 12:
Bible.Verse: 3 For consider him that endured such contradiction of sinners against himself, lest ye be wearied and faint in your minds.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 12:
Bible.Verse: 4 Ye have not yet resisted unto blood, striving against sin.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 12:
Bible.Verse: 5 And ye have forgotten the exhortation which speaketh unto you as unto children, My son, despise not thou the chastening of the Lord, nor faint when thou art rebuked of him:

Bible.Title: Hebrews 12:
Bible.Verse: 6 For whom the Lord loveth he chasteneth, and scourgeth every son whom he receiveth.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 12:
Bible.Verse: 7 If ye endure chastening, God dealeth with you as with sons; for what son is he whom the father chasteneth not?

Bible.Title: Hebrews 12:
Bible.Verse: 8 But if ye be without chastisement, whereof all are partakers, then are ye bastards, and not sons.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 12:
Bible.Verse: 9 Furthermore we have had fathers of our flesh which corrected us, and we gave them reverence: shall we not much rather be in subjection unto the Father of spirits, and live?

Bible.Title: Hebrews 12:
Bible.Verse: 10 For they verily for a few days chastened us after their own pleasure; but he for our profit, that we might be partakers of his holiness.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 12:
Bible.Verse: 11 Now no chastening for the present seemeth to be joyous, but grievous: nevertheless afterward it yieldeth the peaceable fruit of righteousness unto them which are exercised thereby.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 12:
Bible.Verse: 12 Wherefore lift up the hands which hang down, and the feeble knees;

Bible.Title: Hebrews 12:
Bible.Verse: 13 And make straight paths for your feet, lest that which is lame be turned out of the way; but let it rather be healed.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 12:
Bible.Verse: 14 Follow peace with all men, and holiness, without which no man shall see the Lord:

Bible.Title: Hebrews 12:
Bible.Verse: 15 Looking diligently lest any man fail of the grace of God; lest any root of bitterness springing up trouble you, and thereby many be defiled;

Bible.Title: Hebrews 12:
Bible.Verse: 16 Lest there be any fornicator, or profane person, as Esau, who for one morsel of meat sold his birthright.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 12:
Bible.Verse: 17 For ye know how that afterward, when he would have inherited the blessing, he was rejected: for he found no place of repentance, though he sought it carefully with tears.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 12:
Bible.Verse: 18 For ye are not come unto the mount that might be touched, and that burned with fire, nor unto blackness, and darkness, and tempest,

Bible.Title: Hebrews 12:
Bible.Verse: 19 And the sound of a trumpet, and the voice of words; which voice they that heard intreated that the word should not be spoken to them any more:

Bible.Title: Hebrews 12:
Bible.Verse: 20 (For they could not endure that which was commanded, And if so much as a beast touch the mountain, it shall be stoned, or thrust through with a dart:

Bible.Title: Hebrews 12:
Bible.Verse: 21 And so terrible was the sight, that Moses said, I exceedingly fear and quake:)

Bible.Title: Hebrews 12:
Bible.Verse: 22 But ye are come unto mount Sion, and unto the city of the living God, the heavenly Jerusalem, and to an innumerable company of angels,

Bible.Title: Hebrews 12:
Bible.Verse: 23 To the general assembly and church of the firstborn, which are written in heaven, and to God the Judge of all, and to the spirits of just men made perfect,

Bible.Title: Hebrews 12:
Bible.Verse: 24 And to Jesus the mediator of the new covenant, and to the blood of sprinkling, that speaketh better things than that of Abel.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 12:
Bible.Verse: 25 See that ye refuse not him that speaketh. For if they escaped not who refused him that spake on earth, much more shall not we escape, if we turn away from him that speaketh from heaven:

Bible.Title: Hebrews 12:
Bible.Verse: 26 Whose voice then shook the earth: but now he hath promised, saying, Yet once more I shake not the earth only, but also heaven.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 12:
Bible.Verse: 27 And this word, Yet once more, signifieth the removing of those things that are shaken, as of things that are made, that those things which cannot be shaken may remain.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 12:
Bible.Verse: 28 Wherefore we receiving a kingdom which cannot be moved, let us have grace, whereby we may serve God acceptably with reverence and godly fear:

Bible.Title: Hebrews 12:
Bible.Verse: 29 For our God is a consuming fire.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 13:
Bible.Verse: 1 Let brotherly love continue.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 13:
Bible.Verse: 2 Be not forgetful to entertain strangers: for thereby some have entertained angels unawares.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 13:
Bible.Verse: 3 Remember them that are in bonds, as bound with them; and them which suffer adversity, as being yourselves also in the body.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 13:
Bible.Verse: 4 Marriage is honourable in all, and the bed undefiled: but whoremongers and adulterers God will judge.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 13:
Bible.Verse: 5 Let your conversation be without covetousness; and be content with such things as ye have: for he hath said, I will never leave thee, nor forsake thee.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 13:
Bible.Verse: 6 So that we may boldly say, The Lord is my helper, and I will not fear what man shall do unto me.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 13:
Bible.Verse: 7 Remember them which have the rule over you, who have spoken unto you the word of God: whose faith follow, considering the end of their conversation.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 13:
Bible.Verse: 8 Jesus Christ the same yesterday, and to day, and for ever.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 13:
Bible.Verse: 9 Be not carried about with divers and strange doctrines. For it is a good thing that the heart be established with grace; not with meats, which have not profited them that have been occupied therein.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 13:
Bible.Verse: 10 We have an altar, whereof they have no right to eat which serve the tabernacle.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 13:
Bible.Verse: 11 For the bodies of those beasts, whose blood is brought into the sanctuary by the high priest for sin, are burned without the camp.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 13:
Bible.Verse: 12 Wherefore Jesus also, that he might sanctify the people with his own blood, suffered without the gate.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 13:
Bible.Verse: 13 Let us go forth therefore unto him without the camp, bearing his reproach.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 13:
Bible.Verse: 14 For here have we no continuing city, but we seek one to come.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 13:
Bible.Verse: 15 By him therefore let us offer the sacrifice of praise to God continually, that is, the fruit of our lips giving thanks to his name.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 13:
Bible.Verse: 16 But to do good and to communicate forget not: for with such sacrifices God is well pleased.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 13:
Bible.Verse: 17 Obey them that have the rule over you, and submit yourselves: for they watch for your souls, as they that must give account, that they may do it with joy, and not with grief: for that is unprofitable for you.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 13:
Bible.Verse: 18 Pray for us: for we trust we have a good conscience, in all things willing to live honestly.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 13:
Bible.Verse: 19 But I beseech you the rather to do this, that I may be restored to you the sooner.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 13:
Bible.Verse: 20 Now the God of peace, that brought again from the dead our Lord Jesus, that great shepherd of the sheep, through the blood of the everlasting covenant,

Bible.Title: Hebrews 13:
Bible.Verse: 21 Make you perfect in every good work to do his will, working in you that which is wellpleasing in his sight, through Jesus Christ; to whom be glory for ever and ever. Amen.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 13:
Bible.Verse: 22 And I beseech you, brethren, suffer the word of exhortation: for I have written a letter unto you in few words.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 13:
Bible.Verse: 23 Know ye that our brother Timothy is set at liberty; with whom, if he come shortly, I will see you.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 13:
Bible.Verse: 24 Salute all them that have the rule over you, and all the saints. They of Italy salute you.

Bible.Title: Hebrews 13:
Bible.Verse: 25 Grace be with you all. Amen.

Bible.Title: James 1:
Bible.Verse: 1 James, a servant of God and of the Lord Jesus Christ, to the twelve tribes which are scattered abroad, greeting.

Bible.Title: James 1:
Bible.Verse: 2 My brethren, count it all joy when ye fall into divers temptations;

Bible.Title: James 1:
Bible.Verse: 3 Knowing this, that the trying of your faith worketh patience.

Bible.Title: James 1:
Bible.Verse: 4 But let patience have her perfect work, that ye may be perfect and entire, wanting nothing.

Bible.Title: James 1:
Bible.Verse: 5 If any of you lack wisdom, let him ask of God, that giveth to all men liberally, and upbraideth not; and it shall be given him.

Bible.Title: James 1:
Bible.Verse: 6 But let him ask in faith, nothing wavering. For he that wavereth is like a wave of the sea driven with the wind and tossed.

Bible.Title: James 1:
Bible.Verse: 7 For let not that man think that he shall receive any thing of the Lord.

Bible.Title: James 1:
Bible.Verse: 8 A double minded man is unstable in all his ways.

Bible.Title: James 1:
Bible.Verse: 9 Let the brother of low degree rejoice in that he is exalted:

Bible.Title: James 1:
Bible.Verse: 10 But the rich, in that he is made low: because as the flower of the grass he shall pass away.

Bible.Title: James 1:
Bible.Verse: 11 For the sun is no sooner risen with a burning heat, but it withereth the grass, and the flower thereof falleth, and the grace of the fashion of it perisheth: so also shall the rich man fade away in his ways.

Bible.Title: James 1:
Bible.Verse: 12 Blessed is the man that endureth temptation: for when he is tried, he shall receive the crown of life, which the Lord hath promised to them that love him.

Bible.Title: James 1:
Bible.Verse: 13 Let no man say when he is tempted, I am tempted of God: for God cannot be tempted with evil, neither tempteth he any man:

Bible.Title: James 1:
Bible.Verse: 14 But every man is tempted, when he is drawn away of his own lust, and enticed.

Bible.Title: James 1:
Bible.Verse: 15 Then when lust hath conceived, it bringeth forth sin: and sin, when it is finished, bringeth forth death.

Bible.Title: James 1:
Bible.Verse: 16 Do not err, my beloved brethren.

Bible.Title: James 1:
Bible.Verse: 17 Every good gift and every perfect gift is from above, and cometh down from the Father of lights, with whom is no variableness, neither shadow of turning.

Bible.Title: James 1:
Bible.Verse: 18 Of his own will begat he us with the word of truth, that we should be a kind of firstfruits of his creatures.

Bible.Title: James 1:
Bible.Verse: 19 Wherefore, my beloved brethren, let every man be swift to hear, slow to speak, slow to wrath:

Bible.Title: James 1:
Bible.Verse: 20 For the wrath of man worketh not the righteousness of God.

Bible.Title: James 1:
Bible.Verse: 21 Wherefore lay apart all filthiness and superfluity of naughtiness, and receive with meekness the engrafted word, which is able to save your souls.

Bible.Title: James 1:
Bible.Verse: 22 But be ye doers of the word, and not hearers only, deceiving your own selves.

Bible.Title: James 1:
Bible.Verse: 23 For if any be a hearer of the word, and not a doer, he is like unto a man beholding his natural face in a glass:

Bible.Title: James 1:
Bible.Verse: 24 For he beholdeth himself, and goeth his way, and straightway forgetteth what manner of man he was.

Bible.Title: James 1:
Bible.Verse: 25 But whoso looketh into the perfect law of liberty, and continueth therein, he being not a forgetful hearer, but a doer of the work, this man shall be blessed in his deed.

Bible.Title: James 1:
Bible.Verse: 26 If any man among you seem to be religious, and bridleth not his tongue, but deceiveth his own heart, this man's religion is vain.

Bible.Title: James 1:
Bible.Verse: 27 Pure religion and undefiled before God and the Father is this, To visit the fatherless and widows in their affliction, and to keep himself unspotted from the world.

Bible.Title: James 2:
Bible.Verse: 1 My brethren, have not the faith of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Lord of glory, with respect of persons.

Bible.Title: James 2:
Bible.Verse: 2 For if there come unto your assembly a man with a gold ring, in goodly apparel, and there come in also a poor man in vile raiment;

Bible.Title: James 2:
Bible.Verse: 3 And ye have respect to him that weareth the gay clothing, and say unto him, Sit thou here in a good place; and say to the poor, Stand thou there, or sit here under my footstool:

Bible.Title: James 2:
Bible.Verse: 4 Are ye not then partial in yourselves, and are become judges of evil thoughts?

Bible.Title: James 2:
Bible.Verse: 5 Hearken, my beloved brethren, Hath not God chosen the poor of this world rich in faith, and heirs of the kingdom which he hath promised to them that love him?

Bible.Title: James 2:
Bible.Verse: 6 But ye have despised the poor. Do not rich men oppress you, and draw you before the judgment seats?

Bible.Title: James 2:
Bible.Verse: 7 Do not they blaspheme that worthy name by the which ye are called?

Bible.Title: James 2:
Bible.Verse: 8 If ye fulfil the royal law according to the scripture, Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself, ye do well:

Bible.Title: James 2:
Bible.Verse: 9 But if ye have respect to persons, ye commit sin, and are convinced of the law as transgressors.

Bible.Title: James 2:
Bible.Verse: 10 For whosoever shall keep the whole law, and yet offend in one point, he is guilty of all.

Bible.Title: James 2:
Bible.Verse: 11 For he that said, Do not commit adultery, said also, Do not kill. Now if thou commit no adultery, yet if thou kill, thou art become a transgressor of the law.

Bible.Title: James 2:
Bible.Verse: 12 So speak ye, and so do, as they that shall be judged by the law of liberty.

Bible.Title: James 2:
Bible.Verse: 13 For he shall have judgment without mercy, that hath shewed no mercy; and mercy rejoiceth against judgment.

Bible.Title: James 2:
Bible.Verse: 14 What doth it profit, my brethren, though a man say he hath faith, and have not works? can faith save him?

Bible.Title: James 2:
Bible.Verse: 15 If a brother or sister be naked, and destitute of daily food,

Bible.Title: James 2:
Bible.Verse: 16 And one of you say unto them, Depart in peace, be ye warmed and filled; notwithstanding ye give them not those things which are needful to the body; what doth it profit?

Bible.Title: James 2:
Bible.Verse: 17 Even so faith, if it hath not works, is dead, being alone.

Bible.Title: James 2:
Bible.Verse: 18 Yea, a man may say, Thou hast faith, and I have works: shew me thy faith without thy works, and I will shew thee my faith by my works.

Bible.Title: James 2:
Bible.Verse: 19 Thou believest that there is one God; thou doest well: the devils also believe, and tremble.

Bible.Title: James 2:
Bible.Verse: 20 But wilt thou know, O vain man, that faith without works is dead?

Bible.Title: James 2:
Bible.Verse: 21 Was not Abraham our father justified by works, when he had offered Isaac his son upon the altar?

Bible.Title: James 2:
Bible.Verse: 22 Seest thou how faith wrought with his works, and by works was faith made perfect?

Bible.Title: James 2:
Bible.Verse: 23 And the scripture was fulfilled which saith, Abraham believed God, and it was imputed unto him for righteousness: and he was called the Friend of God.

Bible.Title: James 2:
Bible.Verse: 24 Ye see then how that by works a man is justified, and not by faith only.

Bible.Title: James 2:
Bible.Verse: 25 Likewise also was not Rahab the harlot justified by works, when she had received the messengers, and had sent them out another way?

Bible.Title: James 2:
Bible.Verse: 26 For as the body without the spirit is dead, so faith without works is dead also.

Bible.Title: James 3:
Bible.Verse: 1 My brethren, be not many masters, knowing that we shall receive the greater condemnation.

Bible.Title: James 3:
Bible.Verse: 2 For in many things we offend all. If any man offend not in word, the same is a perfect man, and able also to bridle the whole body.

Bible.Title: James 3:
Bible.Verse: 3 Behold, we put bits in the horses' mouths, that they may obey us; and we turn about their whole body.

Bible.Title: James 3:
Bible.Verse: 4 Behold also the ships, which though they be so great, and are driven of fierce winds, yet are they turned about with a very small helm, whithersoever the governor listeth.

Bible.Title: James 3:
Bible.Verse: 5 Even so the tongue is a little member, and boasteth great things. Behold, how great a matter a little fire kindleth!

Bible.Title: James 3:
Bible.Verse: 6 And the tongue is a fire, a world of iniquity: so is the tongue among our members, that it defileth the whole body, and setteth on fire the course of nature; and it is set on fire of hell.

Bible.Title: James 3:
Bible.Verse: 7 For every kind of beasts, and of birds, and of serpents, and of things in the sea, is tamed, and hath been tamed of mankind:

Bible.Title: James 3:
Bible.Verse: 8 But the tongue can no man tame; it is an unruly evil, full of deadly poison.

Bible.Title: James 3:
Bible.Verse: 9 Therewith bless we God, even the Father; and therewith curse we men, which are made after the similitude of God.

Bible.Title: James 3:
Bible.Verse: 10 Out of the same mouth proceedeth blessing and cursing. My brethren, these things ought not so to be.

Bible.Title: James 3:
Bible.Verse: 11 Doth a fountain send forth at the same place sweet water and bitter?

Bible.Title: James 3:
Bible.Verse: 12 Can the fig tree, my brethren, bear olive berries? either a vine, figs? so can no fountain both yield salt water and fresh.

Bible.Title: James 3:
Bible.Verse: 13 Who is a wise man and endued with knowledge among you? let him shew out of a good conversation his works with meekness of wisdom.

Bible.Title: James 3:
Bible.Verse: 14 But if ye have bitter envying and strife in your hearts, glory not, and lie not against the truth.

Bible.Title: James 3:
Bible.Verse: 15 This wisdom descendeth not from above, but is earthly, sensual, devilish.

Bible.Title: James 3:
Bible.Verse: 16 For where envying and strife is, there is confusion and every evil work.

Bible.Title: James 3:
Bible.Verse: 17 But the wisdom that is from above is first pure, then peaceable, gentle, and easy to be intreated, full of mercy and good fruits, without partiality, and without hypocrisy.

Bible.Title: James 3:
Bible.Verse: 18 And the fruit of righteousness is sown in peace of them that make peace.

Bible.Title: James 4:
Bible.Verse: 1 From whence come wars and fightings among you? come they not hence, even of your lusts that war in your members?

Bible.Title: James 4:
Bible.Verse: 2 Ye lust, and have not: ye kill, and desire to have, and cannot obtain: ye fight and war, yet ye have not, because ye ask not.

Bible.Title: James 4:
Bible.Verse: 3 Ye ask, and receive not, because ye ask amiss, that ye may consume it upon your lusts.

Bible.Title: James 4:
Bible.Verse: 4 Ye adulterers and adulteresses, know ye not that the friendship of the world is enmity with God? whosoever therefore will be a friend of the world is the enemy of God.

Bible.Title: James 4:
Bible.Verse: 5 Do ye think that the scripture saith in vain, The spirit that dwelleth in us lusteth to envy?

Bible.Title: James 4:
Bible.Verse: 6 But he giveth more grace. Wherefore he saith, God resisteth the proud, but giveth grace unto the humble.

Bible.Title: James 4:
Bible.Verse: 7 Submit yourselves therefore to God. Resist the devil, and he will flee from you.

Bible.Title: James 4:
Bible.Verse: 8 Draw nigh to God, and he will draw nigh to you. Cleanse your hands, ye sinners; and purify your hearts, ye double minded.

Bible.Title: James 4:
Bible.Verse: 9 Be afflicted, and mourn, and weep: let your laughter be turned to mourning, and your joy to heaviness.

Bible.Title: James 4:
Bible.Verse: 10 Humble yourselves in the sight of the Lord, and he shall lift you up.

Bible.Title: James 4:
Bible.Verse: 11 Speak not evil one of another, brethren. He that speaketh evil of his brother, and judgeth his brother, speaketh evil of the law, and judgeth the law: but if thou judge the law, thou art not a doer of the law, but a judge.

Bible.Title: James 4:
Bible.Verse: 12 There is one lawgiver, who is able to save and to destroy: who art thou that judgest another?

Bible.Title: James 4:
Bible.Verse: 13 Go to now, ye that say, To day or to morrow we will go into such a city, and continue there a year, and buy and sell, and get gain:

Bible.Title: James 4:
Bible.Verse: 14 Whereas ye know not what shall be on the morrow. For what is your life? It is even a vapour, that appeareth for a little time, and then vanisheth away.

Bible.Title: James 4:
Bible.Verse: 15 For that ye ought to say, If the Lord will, we shall live, and do this, or that.

Bible.Title: James 4:
Bible.Verse: 16 But now ye rejoice in your boastings: all such rejoicing is evil.

Bible.Title: James 4:
Bible.Verse: 17 Therefore to him that knoweth to do good, and doeth it not, to him it is sin.

Bible.Title: James 5:
Bible.Verse: 1 Go to now, ye rich men, weep and howl for your miseries that shall come upon you.

Bible.Title: James 5:
Bible.Verse: 2 Your riches are corrupted, and your garments are motheaten.

Bible.Title: James 5:
Bible.Verse: 3 Your gold and silver is cankered; and the rust of them shall be a witness against you, and shall eat your flesh as it were fire. Ye have heaped treasure together for the last days.

Bible.Title: James 5:
Bible.Verse: 4 Behold, the hire of the labourers who have reaped down your fields, which is of you kept back by fraud, crieth: and the cries of them which have reaped are entered into the ears of the Lord of sabaoth.

Bible.Title: James 5:
Bible.Verse: 5 Ye have lived in pleasure on the earth, and been wanton; ye have nourished your hearts, as in a day of slaughter.

Bible.Title: James 5:
Bible.Verse: 6 Ye have condemned and killed the just; and he doth not resist you.

Bible.Title: James 5:
Bible.Verse: 7 Be patient therefore, brethren, unto the coming of the Lord. Behold, the husbandman waiteth for the precious fruit of the earth, and hath long patience for it, until he receive the early and latter rain.

Bible.Title: James 5:
Bible.Verse: 8 Be ye also patient; stablish your hearts: for the coming of the Lord draweth nigh.

Bible.Title: James 5:
Bible.Verse: 9 Grudge not one against another, brethren, lest ye be condemned: behold, the judge standeth before the door.

Bible.Title: James 5:
Bible.Verse: 10 Take, my brethren, the prophets, who have spoken in the name of the Lord, for an example of suffering affliction, and of patience.

Bible.Title: James 5:
Bible.Verse: 11 Behold, we count them happy which endure. Ye have heard of the patience of Job, and have seen the end of the Lord; that the Lord is very pitiful, and of tender mercy.

Bible.Title: James 5:
Bible.Verse: 12 But above all things, my brethren, swear not, neither by heaven, neither by the earth, neither by any other oath: but let your yea be yea; and your nay, nay; lest ye fall into condemnation.

Bible.Title: James 5:
Bible.Verse: 13 Is any among you afflicted? let him pray. Is any merry? let him sing psalms.

Bible.Title: James 5:
Bible.Verse: 14 Is any sick among you? let him call for the elders of the church; and let them pray over him, anointing him with oil in the name of the Lord:

Bible.Title: James 5:
Bible.Verse: 15 And the prayer of faith shall save the sick, and the Lord shall raise him up; and if he have committed sins, they shall be forgiven him.

Bible.Title: James 5:
Bible.Verse: 16 Confess your faults one to another, and pray one for another, that ye may be healed. The effectual fervent prayer of a righteous man availeth much.

Bible.Title: James 5:
Bible.Verse: 17 Elias was a man subject to like passions as we are, and he prayed earnestly that it might not rain: and it rained not on the earth by the space of three years and six months.

Bible.Title: James 5:
Bible.Verse: 18 And he prayed again, and the heaven gave rain, and the earth brought forth her fruit.

Bible.Title: James 5:
Bible.Verse: 19 Brethren, if any of you do err from the truth, and one convert him;

Bible.Title: James 5:
Bible.Verse: 20 Let him know, that he which converteth the sinner from the error of his way shall save a soul from death, and shall hide a multitude of sins.

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 1:
Bible.Verse: 1 Peter, an apostle of Jesus Christ, to the strangers scattered throughout Pontus, Galatia, Cappadocia, Asia, and Bithynia,

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 1:
Bible.Verse: 2 Elect according to the foreknowledge of God the Father, through sanctification of the Spirit, unto obedience and sprinkling of the blood of Jesus Christ: Grace unto you, and peace, be multiplied.

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 1:
Bible.Verse: 3 Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, which according to his abundant mercy hath begotten us again unto a lively hope by the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead,

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 1:
Bible.Verse: 4 To an inheritance incorruptible, and undefiled, and that fadeth not away, reserved in heaven for you,

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 1:
Bible.Verse: 5 Who are kept by the power of God through faith unto salvation ready to be revealed in the last time.

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 1:
Bible.Verse: 6 Wherein ye greatly rejoice, though now for a season, if need be, ye are in heaviness through manifold temptations:

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 1:
Bible.Verse: 7 That the trial of your faith, being much more precious than of gold that perisheth, though it be tried with fire, might be found unto praise and honour and glory at the appearing of Jesus Christ:

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 1:
Bible.Verse: 8 Whom having not seen, ye love; in whom, though now ye see him not, yet believing, ye rejoice with joy unspeakable and full of glory:

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 1:
Bible.Verse: 9 Receiving the end of your faith, even the salvation of your souls.

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 1:
Bible.Verse: 10 Of which salvation the prophets have enquired and searched diligently, who prophesied of the grace that should come unto you:

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 1:
Bible.Verse: 11 Searching what, or what manner of time the Spirit of Christ which was in them did signify, when it testified beforehand the sufferings of Christ, and the glory that should follow.

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 1:
Bible.Verse: 12 Unto whom it was revealed, that not unto themselves, but unto us they did minister the things, which are now reported unto you by them that have preached the gospel unto you with the Holy Ghost sent down from heaven; which things the angels desire to look into.

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 1:
Bible.Verse: 13 Wherefore gird up the loins of your mind, be sober, and hope to the end for the grace that is to be brought unto you at the revelation of Jesus Christ;

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 1:
Bible.Verse: 14 As obedient children, not fashioning yourselves according to the former lusts in your ignorance:

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 1:
Bible.Verse: 15 But as he which hath called you is holy, so be ye holy in all manner of conversation;

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 1:
Bible.Verse: 16 Because it is written, Be ye holy; for I am holy.

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 1:
Bible.Verse: 17 And if ye call on the Father, who without respect of persons judgeth according to every man's work, pass the time of your sojourning here in fear:

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 1:
Bible.Verse: 18 Forasmuch as ye know that ye were not redeemed with corruptible things, as silver and gold, from your vain conversation received by tradition from your fathers;

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 1:
Bible.Verse: 19 But with the precious blood of Christ, as of a lamb without blemish and without spot:

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 1:
Bible.Verse: 20 Who verily was foreordained before the foundation of the world, but was manifest in these last times for you,

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 1:
Bible.Verse: 21 Who by him do believe in God, that raised him up from the dead, and gave him glory; that your faith and hope might be in God.

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 1:
Bible.Verse: 22 Seeing ye have purified your souls in obeying the truth through the Spirit unto unfeigned love of the brethren, see that ye love one another with a pure heart fervently:

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 1:
Bible.Verse: 23 Being born again, not of corruptible seed, but of incorruptible, by the word of God, which liveth and abideth for ever.

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 1:
Bible.Verse: 24 For all flesh is as grass, and all the glory of man as the flower of grass. The grass withereth, and the flower thereof falleth away:

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 1:
Bible.Verse: 25 But the word of the Lord endureth for ever. And this is the word which by the gospel is preached unto you.

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 2:
Bible.Verse: 1 Wherefore laying aside all malice, and all guile, and hypocrisies, and envies, and all evil speakings,

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 2:
Bible.Verse: 2 As newborn babes, desire the sincere milk of the word, that ye may grow thereby:

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 2:
Bible.Verse: 3 If so be ye have tasted that the Lord is gracious.

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 2:
Bible.Verse: 4 To whom coming, as unto a living stone, disallowed indeed of men, but chosen of God, and precious,

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 2:
Bible.Verse: 5 Ye also, as lively stones, are built up a spiritual house, an holy priesthood, to offer up spiritual sacrifices, acceptable to God by Jesus Christ.

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 2:
Bible.Verse: 6 Wherefore also it is contained in the scripture, Behold, I lay in Sion a chief corner stone, elect, precious: and he that believeth on him shall not be confounded.

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 2:
Bible.Verse: 7 Unto you therefore which believe he is precious: but unto them which be disobedient, the stone which the builders disallowed, the same is made the head of the corner,

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 2:
Bible.Verse: 8 And a stone of stumbling, and a rock of offence, even to them which stumble at the word, being disobedient: whereunto also they were appointed.

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 2:
Bible.Verse: 9 But ye are a chosen generation, a royal priesthood, an holy nation, a peculiar people; that ye should shew forth the praises of him who hath called you out of darkness into his marvellous light:

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 2:
Bible.Verse: 10 Which in time past were not a people, but are now the people of God: which had not obtained mercy, but now have obtained mercy.

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 2:
Bible.Verse: 11 Dearly beloved, I beseech you as strangers and pilgrims, abstain from fleshly lusts, which war against the soul;

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 2:
Bible.Verse: 12 Having your conversation honest among the Gentiles: that, whereas they speak against you as evildoers, they may by your good works, which they shall behold, glorify God in the day of visitation.

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 2:
Bible.Verse: 13 Submit yourselves to every ordinance of man for the Lord's sake: whether it be to the king, as supreme;

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 2:
Bible.Verse: 14 Or unto governors, as unto them that are sent by him for the punishment of evildoers, and for the praise of them that do well.

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 2:
Bible.Verse: 15 For so is the will of God, that with well doing ye may put to silence the ignorance of foolish men:

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 2:
Bible.Verse: 16 As free, and not using your liberty for a cloke of maliciousness, but as the servants of God.

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 2:
Bible.Verse: 17 Honour all men. Love the brotherhood. Fear God. Honour the king.

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 2:
Bible.Verse: 18 Servants, be subject to your masters with all fear; not only to the good and gentle, but also to the froward.

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 2:
Bible.Verse: 19 For this is thankworthy, if a man for conscience toward God endure grief, suffering wrongfully.

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 2:
Bible.Verse: 20 For what glory is it, if, when ye be buffeted for your faults, ye shall take it patiently? but if, when ye do well, and suffer for it, ye take it patiently, this is acceptable with God.

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 2:
Bible.Verse: 21 For even hereunto were ye called: because Christ also suffered for us, leaving us an example, that ye should follow his steps:

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 2:
Bible.Verse: 22 Who did no sin, neither was guile found in his mouth:

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 2:
Bible.Verse: 23 Who, when he was reviled, reviled not again; when he suffered, he threatened not; but committed himself to him that judgeth righteously:

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 2:
Bible.Verse: 24 Who his own self bare our sins in his own body on the tree, that we, being dead to sins, should live unto righteousness: by whose stripes ye were healed.

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 2:
Bible.Verse: 25 For ye were as sheep going astray; but are now returned unto the Shepherd and Bishop of your souls.

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 3:
Bible.Verse: 1 Likewise, ye wives, be in subjection to your own husbands; that, if any obey not the word, they also may without the word be won by the conversation of the wives;

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 3:
Bible.Verse: 2 While they behold your chaste conversation coupled with fear.

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 3:
Bible.Verse: 3 Whose adorning let it not be that outward adorning of plaiting the hair, and of wearing of gold, or of putting on of apparel;

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 3:
Bible.Verse: 4 But let it be the hidden man of the heart, in that which is not corruptible, even the ornament of a meek and quiet spirit, which is in the sight of God of great price.

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 3:
Bible.Verse: 5 For after this manner in the old time the holy women also, who trusted in God, adorned themselves, being in subjection unto their own husbands:

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 3:
Bible.Verse: 6 Even as Sara obeyed Abraham, calling him lord: whose daughters ye are, as long as ye do well, and are not afraid with any amazement.

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 3:
Bible.Verse: 7 Likewise, ye husbands, dwell with them according to knowledge, giving honour unto the wife, as unto the weaker vessel, and as being heirs together of the grace of life; that your prayers be not hindered.

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 3:
Bible.Verse: 8 Finally, be ye all of one mind, having compassion one of another, love as brethren, be pitiful, be courteous:

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 3:
Bible.Verse: 9 Not rendering evil for evil, or railing for railing: but contrariwise blessing; knowing that ye are thereunto called, that ye should inherit a blessing.

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 3:
Bible.Verse: 10 For he that will love life, and see good days, let him refrain his tongue from evil, and his lips that they speak no guile:

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 3:
Bible.Verse: 11 Let him eschew evil, and do good; let him seek peace, and ensue it.

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 3:
Bible.Verse: 12 For the eyes of the Lord are over the righteous, and his ears are open unto their prayers: but the face of the Lord is against them that do evil.

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 3:
Bible.Verse: 13 And who is he that will harm you, if ye be followers of that which is good?

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 3:
Bible.Verse: 14 But and if ye suffer for righteousness' sake, happy are ye: and be not afraid of their terror, neither be troubled;

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 3:
Bible.Verse: 15 But sanctify the Lord God in your hearts: and be ready always to give an answer to every man that asketh you a reason of the hope that is in you with meekness and fear:

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 3:
Bible.Verse: 16 Having a good conscience; that, whereas they speak evil of you, as of evildoers, they may be ashamed that falsely accuse your good conversation in Christ.

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 3:
Bible.Verse: 17 For it is better, if the will of God be so, that ye suffer for well doing, than for evil doing.

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 3:
Bible.Verse: 18 For Christ also hath once suffered for sins, the just for the unjust, that he might bring us to God, being put to death in the flesh, but quickened by the Spirit:

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 3:
Bible.Verse: 19 By which also he went and preached unto the spirits in prison;

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 3:
Bible.Verse: 20 Which sometime were disobedient, when once the longsuffering of God waited in the days of Noah, while the ark was a preparing, wherein few, that is, eight souls were saved by water.

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 3:
Bible.Verse: 21 The like figure whereunto even baptism doth also now save us (not the putting away of the filth of the flesh, but the answer of a good conscience toward God,) by the resurrection of Jesus Christ:

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 3:
Bible.Verse: 22 Who is gone into heaven, and is on the right hand of God; angels and authorities and powers being made subject unto him.

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 4:
Bible.Verse: 1 Forasmuch then as Christ hath suffered for us in the flesh, arm yourselves likewise with the same mind: for he that hath suffered in the flesh hath ceased from sin;

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 4:
Bible.Verse: 2 That he no longer should live the rest of his time in the flesh to the lusts of men, but to the will of God.

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 4:
Bible.Verse: 3 For the time past of our life may suffice us to have wrought the will of the Gentiles, when we walked in lasciviousness, lusts, excess of wine, revellings, banquetings, and abominable idolatries:

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 4:
Bible.Verse: 4 Wherein they think it strange that ye run not with them to the same excess of riot, speaking evil of you:

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 4:
Bible.Verse: 5 Who shall give account to him that is ready to judge the quick and the dead.

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 4:
Bible.Verse: 6 For for this cause was the gospel preached also to them that are dead, that they might be judged according to men in the flesh, but live according to God in the spirit.

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 4:
Bible.Verse: 7 But the end of all things is at hand: be ye therefore sober, and watch unto prayer.

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 4:
Bible.Verse: 8 And above all things have fervent charity among yourselves: for charity shall cover the multitude of sins.

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 4:
Bible.Verse: 9 Use hospitality one to another without grudging.

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 4:
Bible.Verse: 10 As every man hath received the gift, even so minister the same one to another, as good stewards of the manifold grace of God.

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 4:
Bible.Verse: 11 If any man speak, let him speak as the oracles of God; if any man minister, let him do it as of the ability which God giveth: that God in all things may be glorified through Jesus Christ, to whom be praise and dominion for ever and ever. Amen.

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 4:
Bible.Verse: 12 Beloved, think it not strange concerning the fiery trial which is to try you, as though some strange thing happened unto you:

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 4:
Bible.Verse: 13 But rejoice, inasmuch as ye are partakers of Christ's sufferings; that, when his glory shall be revealed, ye may be glad also with exceeding joy.

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 4:
Bible.Verse: 14 If ye be reproached for the name of Christ, happy are ye; for the spirit of glory and of God resteth upon you: on their part he is evil spoken of, but on your part he is glorified.

Bible.Title: 1 Peter 4:
